page.title: 15Farms in the Rolvenden Area
page.content: {Friezingham Farm} is a mixed farm of about 350 acres. Over half of this is pasture (with some marsh) and there are hop gardens, orchards (including a plum orchard) and arable (cereals). {Fish farming}has recently been introduced into the area. Using a wind pump, fresh water from Chalybeate Spring is pumped into man-made fish ponds along the banks of Newmill Channel and crayfish are brought to maturity there. Some children are lucky enough to live on a farm.{Shane}describes the year as he sees it: {The cows calf from September to May {usually. When calfing stops they stay {outdoors for an hour or two. On the {first day of June they start making {silage. In Autumn the cows come in {again. It's nice and warm in the {cowshed in the Winter and it smells."
